text.text:
We booked this hotel via Booking.com initially, but the hotel canceled our reservation, claiming they didn’t receive the expected payment. We had to pay the amount directly to the hotel, so if you're booking through Booking.com, it’s best to double-check with the property beforehand.

The hotel is conveniently located near the bus stop and train station, making it easy to access. The building is quite new, but a large part of it is still under construction. The rooms are decent—nothing fancy but sufficient for a short stay.

The staff is friendly but seems inexperienced, which reflects in the overall service. They do offer food, but the menu is very limited. There is a small 8-seater dining area (around 10x10 in size). Breakfast was included in our booking, but they served only one item, which was quite basic.

If you're looking for a budget-friendly place just to crash and freshen up, this hotel is okay. However, don’t expect a high level of comfort or service. Overall, it was an average experience.

text.text:
Issue 1: Fake review added by Hotel Shaligram Inn Team on Booking.com on my name dated 26th March, 25. Absolutely cheap behavior.

Issue 2: Feedback on My Experience at Hotel Shaligram Inn, Ahmedabad

I am writing to share my recent experience at Hotel Shaligram Inn, Ahmedabad, dated 25th March, 25 which was disappointing due to a lack of professionalism and poor communication.

At the time of booking on booking.com, I had explicitly requested an early check-in, two hours before the standard time. I received an email confirmation stating that the Shaligram Inn hotel management would try to accommodate us upon arrival. I also directly contacted the hotel to confirm the request via phone and WhatsApp, and there were no objections from their side.

However, on the day of my visit, the management was uncooperative and dismissive. Without even checking room availability, they firmly refused any possibility of accommodating the early check-in. Their tone was aggressive, and they displayed a lack of professionalism and basic customer service etiquette.

Despite the initial inconvenience, I managed to convince them to hold my luggage while I waited for the standard check-in time. This unnecessary delay caused a significant disruption to my plans. Although the rest of my stay was smooth and comfortable, the staff’s attitude and lack of hospitality left a lasting negative impression.

There are much better and economical hotels in the vicinity.

If you are a cleanliness freak please don't visit. Not sure how they got a 3.9 star definitely lot of fake reviews.

My booking wasn't declined I stayed there and this is a genuine review please don't mention false responses to misguide customers.

text.text: During my 10-day business trip to Ahmedabad, I stayed at Hotel Kinara and had a consistently positive experience. The room was not only spotlessly clean but also very comfortable and well-maintained throughout my stay, making it a pleasant place to return to after work. I found the pricing to be very fair and affordable, offering excellent value. The reception staff deserve special mention for their genuinely friendly and helpful service, which made check-in and daily interactions smooth. A significant advantage for me was the hotel's proximity to a mosque, making it incredibly convenient for attending my regular prayers without hassle. Based on my enjoyable and hassle-free stay, I highly recommend Hotel Kinara, especially for Muslim travelers and business visitors seeking comfort and value.

text.text:
Good Hotel - But the location is market area

Pros:
* Rooms and bathrooms are clean and well maintained.
* Service is very Good.
* Nearby railway station. But not walkable distance.

Cons: All are related to location.
* Located in a Muslim are area.
* No Veg restaurant nearby, you will have to go to end of the road near railway station where you see 3 good veg restaurants.
* Road is too much crowded and traffic. Even if the veg restaurants i mentioned is just 300m away you will not be able to walk. Everyone on road are rash driving and you will not find any way to walk.
* Due to Too much traffic, that it will take atleast 30-40 min to reach railway station which is only 1km away. If you think you can walk 1km, even that is not possible in that road.

Note : Since the hotel is situated in main market area, it is crowded. If you are ok with it go ahead, no issues with the stay.

If you do it offline, they charge you nearly 20% extra. You book one kind of room and you get different type of room. If you ask them that it is different from the one mentioned in website, get ready to hear all sorts of nonsense excuses. They don't even know how to treat their guests or even how to behave. For one single person booking they give two separate beds room and if you do it offline they will happily give you one queen size bed room. In my entire travel life of nearly 15+ years have never came across such pathetic peoples. I wish google had option of giving negative stars.

Absolutely unprofessional service.
Rude staff, fooling customers by confirming booking on call and then after reaching the hotel within half hour, they are telling rooms are not available and asking to go for premium rooms only.

The lady on call asked me to pay 1000/- to confirm booking to which I replied that as I am only few mins away, I will directly make payment at hotel and she agreed and confirmed.

Why confirm on call when you didn’t have availability?
Just so that they can rip you off after reaching hotel.
Clearly they didn’t have any intention of giving the said room and just wanted to lock the amount to force into buying premium rooms.

And the reception is completely unwelcoming.
I would have still gone for premium rooms with better hospitality.

text.text:
Title: Unethical Pricing, Hidden Charges & Misleading Practices – Extremely Disappointed with Hotel G Express, Ahmedabad

My experience at Hotel G Express was not just disappointing — it was completely unacceptable and bordered on fraudulent.

✅ Online Room Rate:
The room was listed online at ₹1,710 + taxes, totaling ₹1,910 per night. However, on calling the hotel directly, I was quoted ₹4,000 per night — more than double the listed price. After negotiation, they reduced it to ₹3,000, which is still overpriced and unjustified.

❌ Lack of Transparent Pricing:
Nowhere on their official website or booking platforms was there any mention of extra charges for early check-in, dynamic pricing, or any policy that explains these absurd rates. No policy documents, disclaimers, or terms & conditions were provided at the time of inquiry or booking.

❌ Early Check-In Scam:
We checked in early at 6 AM. Most hotels with availability offer complimentary early check-in, or at worst, apply reasonable charges. In our case, no such transparency existed — and early check-in was used as an excuse to inflate our bill to ₹6,000 for 2 nights, almost 60% higher than the standard rate.

✅ Industry Standards Ignored:
A professional hotel:

Discloses all extra charges clearly in writing (on their website, confirmation emails, or during phone bookings)
Doesn’t exploit customers with dynamic pricing on call that differs drastically from online platforms
Offers fair early check-in policies, especially when rooms are available
Issues tax invoices with a breakdown of charges — which we were also not provided at the time
❌ No Respect for Guests:
Instead of welcoming the guest and honoring fair rates, they took advantage of the situation. It shows a lack of customer respect, poor ethics, and an attempt to profit through confusion and manipulation.

Please do not go.

text.text:
A very Budgeted and pleasant stay at Hotel Dev Palace.
A Family oriented hotel with in house butler facility, who cooks delicious Home Like food, in a very Affordable Range.
My room was closer to the reception area and very spacious for husband-wife & daughter.
AC was well functioning and super chilled atmos, during our 2 nights stay.
If you are for Business Trip, it's very close to Safal-3 , almost 100/ 150 mtrs away only.
I checked in by 11:45 AM but they allowed me late check out by 1 hr. Hope someday, if we are in need for early check in,  they will accomodate us.
Mr. Vinod & Mr. Jayesh were courteous and all other ground staff were humble.
It's 100% safe too!
I loved their food, tea !!
They do Pooja regularly too!
Nice stay and next time too, if I'm on business trip, this is the spot,  where I'm choosing my stay!

Few advices/suggestions :
1. There should be a room spray for rooms and lobby, for good ambience.
2. There should install toilet roll paper in washroom.
3. 2 water bottles in a day should be complementary (although they provide R.O. water)
4. Shower towels should be replaced.

I don't have any complaints.

Fit for all...

text.text:
I check this hotel/Dormitory rooms

They have 2 versions of Rooms Available here.

1. AC room/Bunk bed dormitory
( This is the bed bunk bed dormitory option for travellers who are interested in AC, dormitory, good service, bag storage units etc.)

2. Now AC rooms/ single beds approx 6-8 beds inside a lage room.( It lacks ventilation, I felt hot and uneasy. Located in a bottom/downstairs od this dormitory. Here it's single beds no bunk beds.)

(I will suggest going for AC bunk beds. Avoid NON AC it's suffocating with a bad smell.)

Advantages
1. Good AC bunk beds available
2. Nice reception
3. Storage options available for each. (Small/medium luggage space.)

Disadvantages
1. Their are lots of hotels in this name. (Hence, I went their to check physically) - Now you can see the details in the photos attached.

2. Offline booking and Online booking check out timming may vary (i.e. offline booking has a advantage of 24 hours check-out.But online booking traveler may face some issues. I suggest to call them).

3. Check the guidelines as some services are charged in this hotel/dormitory.

I hope this information helps the upcoming travelers to make a decision.

text.text:
Best part of the hotel was its location – near the railway station, close to good markets, right in the city centre, and just outside Gate No. 3 of the iconic Kankaria Lake. We booked on hourly basis (6 hours) and were fairly charged (around half of a full day booking).

But the room overall was just near average. Paint had peeled out in places, there were damp patches on the wall, and even a broken floor tile. The main door was so tight that my mother could not shut it without force. At check-in I even heard staff say there was a problem with the allotted room, but the senior dismissed it saying, “they are hourly stay clients.” This attitude was disappointing.

The bathroom made matters worse – no exhaust fan (only a blocked exhaust window), dustbin partly broken, bucket cracked, and all plastic items (bucket, mug, dustbin, stool) looked dirty with a greyish layer. The hand towel hanger was corroded and looked unhygienic. Also, there were no cloth hangers (though it seemed they were never fixed back once broken).

We were to check out at 8:00 PM but left by 6:00 PM to support the hotel’s margins. I hope this gesture is appreciated by the hotel.

This hotel has an excellent location advantage, but unless basic upkeep and hygiene are improved, guests will not return.

originalText.text:
Best part of the hotel was its location – near the railway station, close to good markets, right in the city centre, and just outside Gate No. 3 of the iconic Kankaria Lake. We booked on hourly basis (6 hours) and were fairly charged (around half of a full day booking).

But the room overall was just near average. Paint had peeled out in places, there were damp patches on the wall, and even a broken floor tile. The main door was so tight that my mother could not shut it without force. At check-in I even heard staff say there was a problem with the allotted room, but the senior dismissed it saying, “they are hourly stay clients.” This attitude was disappointing.

The bathroom made matters worse – no exhaust fan (only a blocked exhaust window), dustbin partly broken, bucket cracked, and all plastic items (bucket, mug, dustbin, stool) looked dirty with a greyish layer. The hand towel hanger was corroded and looked unhygienic. Also, there were no cloth hangers (though it seemed they were never fixed back once broken).

We were to check out at 8:00 PM but left by 6:00 PM to support the hotel’s margins. I hope this gesture is appreciated by the hotel.

This hotel has an excellent location advantage, but unless basic upkeep and hygiene are improved, guests will not return.

text.text:
A Hidden Gem in Ahmedabad – Unforgettable Stay at CITY INN

We recently had the pleasure of staying at CITY INN in Ahmedabad, and we were absolutely blown away by the experience. From the moment we stepped in, we were greeted with warmth and hospitality, making us feel at home instantly. The hotel is a perfect blend of comfort, elegance, and exceptional service, and we couldn’t have asked for more during our stay.

A special mention must go to Aakash, the manager, who went above and beyond to ensure that every aspect of our stay was perfect. His attention to detail and genuine care for his guests made all the difference. Whether it was recommending local spots to explore, or simply checking in to see if we were comfortable, Aakash truly made us feel like family. His kindness and dedication left a lasting impression on us, and it's rare to come across someone who takes such pride in their work.

The rooms were spotless, the food was delicious, and every corner of the hotel reflected their commitment to excellence. The staff as a whole were attentive and responsive, but it was Aakash’s personal touch that made this stay unforgettable.

If you’re ever in Ahmedabad, CITY INN is more than just a place to stay—it’s a place where you’ll feel truly cared for. Thank you, Aakash, and the entire team for making our trip so special. We’ll definitely be back!

If you’re looking for a budget friendly hotel in Ahmedabad, look no further than Hotel Prime.

Nearby landmarks such as Adalaj Step-well (1.3 mi) and Akshardham Temple (1.5 mi) make Hotel Prime a great place to stay when visiting Ahmedabad.

Rooms at Hotel Prime offer air conditioning providing exceptional comfort and convenience, and guests can go online with free wifi.

Room service is one of the conveniences offered at this hotel. If you are driving to Hotel Prime, free parking is available.

While in Ahmedabad, you may want to check out some of the restaurants that are a short walk away from Hotel Prime, including Patang (0.6 mi), Agashiye (0.1 mi), and Pakwan Dining Hall (0.8 mi).

If you’re looking for things to do, you can check out Sabarmati Riverfront (0.7 mi), Manek Chowk (0.1 mi), or Hathee Singh Jain Temple (1.1 mi), which are popular attractions amongst tourists, and they are all within walking distance.

The staff at Hotel Prime looks forward to serving you during your upcoming visit.

text.text:
My recent stay at Alka Inn, a three-star hotel, was surprisingly pleasant. The rooms were impeccably maintained, showcasing high levels of cleanliness and hygiene. I was impressed by the modern amenities provided, including complimentary toiletries like a comb, toothpaste, toothbrush, and soaps – a thoughtful touch that exceeded my expectations.

The highlight of my stay was the delicious buffet breakfast. The variety and quality of food were excellent, making every mealtime a delightful experience. The restaurant team deserves commendation for their prompt service and hospitality.

However, I did notice a slight downside with the reception team, mainly composed of older individuals who lacked a welcoming demeanor. It would be beneficial for the management to consider replacing them with a younger, more energetic team to enhance guest interactions.

Despite this minor issue, I wholeheartedly recommend Alka Inn to everyone seeking a comfortable and enjoyable stay. It's a fantastic choice with modern amenities, delicious food, and a welcoming atmosphere overall.

text.text:
Don’t get fooled by the entrance, this place is great.
I don’t understand the bad reviews..! The people leaving them must be very haughty western tourists who shouldn’t come to India. 😅😂
I am from France and this is my 5th time in India.  I have travelled all over the country ON A BUDGET and I can tell you that this is the cleanest hotel I have ever been in the whole country.
And if you know Ahmedabad you know it is really hard to find a cheap and correct place IN this city when you are a budget traveller!!
In my experience, this hotel was clean. I mean western standard clean. AC works perfect, bed sheets are clean and blanket is thick. Bathroom was clean with hot water and even the toilet flush works perfectly too. They even give you toothpaste, toothbrush, soap and shampoo, and shaving utensils. For around 1000 rupees in Ahmedabad this is the best you will find, trust me.

text.text:
Good Hotel - But the location is market area

Pros:
* Rooms and bathrooms are clean and well maintained.
* Service is very Good.
* Nearby railway station. But not walkable distance.

Cons: All are related to location.
* Located in a Muslim are area.
* No Veg restaurant nearby, you will have to go to end of the road near railway station where you see 3 good veg restaurants.
* Road is too much crowded and traffic. Even if the veg restaurants i mentioned is just 300m away you will not be able to walk. Everyone on road are rash driving and you will not find any way to walk.
* Due to Too much traffic, that it will take atleast 30-40 min to reach railway station which is only 1km away. If you think you can walk 1km, even that is not possible in that road.

Note : Since the hotel is situated in main market area, it is crowded. If you are ok with it go ahead, no issues with the stay.

text.text:
After a month on the road it was an absolute pleasure to spend four nights here ahead of a train to Mumbai.

Issues with the WiFi became comical
But were fixed.

The room was excellent, really enjoyed despite being here whilst four days of
Festival was going on at night at the water park next door.

Enjoyed the park next door - hated the zoo, it needs to be closed -
Don’t waste your money.

The staff at the hotel were very accommodating - and by that I mean everyone from front of house to house keeping - Pretti you are an angel x

Restaurant serves excellent food, well worth the slight price loading.  Strange QR code ordering process.

Would definitely stay again if in the area.  Thank you 🙏🏻 we left recharged

text.text:
Our family had a wonderful 4 nights and 5 days stay at Hotel G Express Ahmedabad. Being right next to Kankaria Lake was a real bonus, especially for the kids – they loved all the activities and the zoo nearby. The rooms were clean and comfortable, which made our stay even more enjoyable. Plus, the hotel's central location meant we had easy access to local transport options, making it a breeze to explore the city.

Hotel G Express Ahmedabad proved to be an affordable choice for our family trip, offering basic facilities that met our needs perfectly. It was great to have a comfortable place to stay without breaking the bank, allowing us to focus more on enjoying our time in Ahmedabad with the kids
